title: Led Zeppelin - How The West Was Won 48/24 FLAC
description:
"While I was searching through the archives for visual and audio material for the Led Zeppelin DVD I re-discovered these 1972 performances from the 25th June, LA Forum and 27th June, Long Beach Arena. This is Lead Zeppelin at its best and an illustration of How The West Was Won." - Jimmy Page, London, March 2003 

And so Jimmy Page, along with engineer and mixer Kevin Shirley, choose the best of those two nights and created Led Zeppelin's best live album, and one of the greatest live albums of all time. 

Originally released as a 3 CD set, this 48kHz 24-bit version is based on the stereo mix available on the 2 Disc DVD-Audio version, which was remastered by George Marino. Only difference is the fade-in-and-out between tracks 11 & 12 has been removed. This was originally going to be done by flying in the CD version at the point, but it was discovered that, by carefully overlapping the two tracks, the fades cancelled out perfectly without any phasing or other artifacts. 

In lossless FLAC format with replay gain metadata 

01. LA Drone 
02. Immigrant Song 
03. heartbreaker 
04. Black Dog 
05. Over The Hills and Far Away 
06. Since I've Been Loving You 
07. Stairway To Heaven 
08. Going To California 
09. That's the Way 
10. Bron-Yr-Aur Stomp 
11. Dazed and Confused (Medley) - Walter's Walk - The Crunge 
12. What Is And What Should Never Be 
13. Dancing Days 
14. Moby Dick 
15. Whole Lotta Love (Medley) - Boogie Chillun - Let's Have A Party - Hello Marylou - Going Down Slow 
16. Rock and Roll 
17. The Ocean 
18. Bring It On Home (Medley) - Bring It On Back
